frame.name: Reparation
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe the process of making amends for some (wrongful) action (the <fen>Injury</fen>) committed by the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen>. In this process, in order to appease the <fen>Injured_party</fen> or to follow laws or customs, the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> performs some <fen>Benefiting_action</fen> for the <fen>Injured_party</fen> or gives the <fen>Injured_party</fen> some <fen>Gift</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Wrongdoer">I</fex> will <t>make</t> <fex name="Injury">it</fex> <t>up</t> <fex name="Injured_party">to you</fex>.</ex> <ex>Sinn Fein said that <fex name="Wrongdoer">the marchers</fex> had to <m>make</m> <t>restitution</t> <fex name="Injured_party">to the Catholics</fex> <fex name="Injury">for the disruption and violence</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Wrongdoer">The tribesmen</fex> tried to <m>make</m> <t>amends</t> <fex name="Injured_party">to us</fex> <fex name="Gift">with handfuls of their most precious seashells</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Injured_party
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Injured_party</fen> was affected by some previous wrongful act of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> and who should benefit from the reparations. <ex>You can never make <t>amends</t> <fex name="Injrd_prty">to Susan</fex> for standing her up.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Injury
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action that the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> committed against the <fen>Injured_party</fen>. Although conceptually present, this FE need not always be realized. <ex>Wyelander sought <t>reparations</t> <fex name="Injury">for the brutal murder of his nephew</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Wrongdoer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends to the <fen>Injured_party</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>. <ex>How can <fex name="Wrongdoer">I</fex> <t>make</t> it <t>up</t> to you?</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Benefiting_action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Benefiting_action</fen> is performed by the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> to make amends. <ex>Between friends, <t>amends</t> can be made <fex name="Bene">by apologizing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Gift
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Gift</fen> identifies the entity that the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> gives to the <fen>Injured_party</fen>. <ex>He <t>made</t> it <t>up</t> to her <fex name="Gift">with a bouquet of flowers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Manner</fen> marks any description of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen>'s making of reparations not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification, (e.g. <ment>probably</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (e.g. <ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> that also affect the action ( e.g. <ment>presumptuously</ment>). <ex>Smeagol <fex name="Mnr">humbly</fex> made <t>amends</t> for his earlier bad behavior.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends. <ex><t>Restitution</t> was given <fex name="Place">in Milan</fex> with the Treaty of Abiselle.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when amends are made. <ex>He made <t>amends</t> to her <fex name="Time">that very afternoon</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes restitution to the <fen>Injured_party</fen>. <ex>He thinks that Japan made <t>restitution</t> for the incident <fex name="Purp">to lull Americans into complacency</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> makes amends for the <fen>Injury</fen> .
<ex>Of course, they won't be able to <t>make</t> it <t>up</t> to you <fex name="Degree">completely</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: reparation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the making of amends for a wrong

lexUnit.name: restitution.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the restoration of something to its original state

lexUnit.name: amends.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an action or actions performed to benefit someone whom one has injured; reparation

lexUnit.name: make up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make reparation (for), to compensate (for)
